  "error_location": "LBO!L140 (Cash Flow Statement - Cash from Investing), copied across M140:P140",
  "current_formula": "=L139",

  "logical_explanation": "Maintenance Capex (row 138) is correctly calculated as a cash outflow, but it is excluded from 'Cash from Investing' (row 140). As a result, Free Cash Flow (row 143) and Ending Cash (row 150) are overstated by exactly the Maintenance Capex amount each year, while the Balance Sheet PP&E still reflects the capex via the PP&E roll-forward. This creates a Balance Sheet imbalance starting in 2022 equal to the omitted Maintenance Capex (the variance matches the magnitude and opposite sign of row 138). Including both Maintenance and Growth Capex in Cash from Investing fixes the cash link and ties the Balance Sheet.",
  "audit_steps_followed": [
    "Variance Analysis: identified the first break year (2022 / column L) where the Check row becomes non-zero and observed the variance grows over time",
    "Half-Number / Sign Check: matched the 2022 variance (33.8682) to the exact opposite-signed value in Maintenance Capex (row 138 = -33.8682), indicating an omitted cash flow line rather than a doubling/sign flip",
    "Linkage Integrity: confirmed the cash link (BS Cash ties to CFS EoP Cash) and isolated the issue to the CFS aggregation in 'Cash from Investing' where Maintenance Capex was not included"
  ]
}

parsed_response.error_location: LBO!L140 (Cash Flow Statement - Cash from Investing), copied across M140:P140
parsed_response.logical_explanation: Maintenance Capex (row 138) is correctly calculated as a cash outflow, but it is excluded from 'Cash from Investing' (row 140). As a result, Free Cash Flow (row 143) and Ending Cash (row 150) are overstated by exactly the Maintenance Capex amount each year, while the Balance Sheet PP&E still reflects the capex via the PP&E roll-forward. This creates a Balance Sheet imbalance starting in 2022 equal to the omitted Maintenance Capex (the variance matches the magnitude and opposite sign of row 138). Including both Maintenance and Growth Capex in Cash from Investing fixes the cash link and ties the Balance Sheet.
audit_steps_followed: Variance Analysis: identified the first break year (2022 / column L) where the Check row becomes non-zero and observed the variance grows over time

Half-Number / Sign Check: matched the 2022 variance (33.8682) to the exact opposite-signed value in Maintenance Capex (row 138 = -33.8682), indicating an omitted cash flow line rather than a doubling/sign flip
Linkage Integrity: confirmed the cash link (BS Cash ties to CFS EoP Cash) and isolated the issue to the CFS aggregation in 'Cash from Investing' where Maintenance Capex was not included
